Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Abraham Aizelman, Ozone Park Jewish Center, Ozone Park, Queens.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Addabbo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Abraham Aizelman, Ozone Park Jewish Center, Ozone Park, Queens.

Council Member Addabbo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 11, 2005 be adopted and printed by Council Member Gioia.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gioia moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 11, 2005 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 420-A, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the Hindu festival of Diwali.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto, Int. No. 420-A - Suspend alternate side of the street parking rules on the Hindu festival Diwali.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Bronx Borough President - Submitting the name of Kenneth J. Knuckles to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his reappointment to the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Section 192(a) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Kenneth J. Knuckles, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

Discussion of General Orders

Report of the Committee on Finance

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the DUMBO business improvement district.

Items.Title: Resolution amending and Restating the Resolution to Provide the Amounts Necessary for the Support of the Government of the City of New York and the Counties Therein and for the Payment of Indebtedness Thereof, for the Fiscal Year Beginning on July 1, 2005 and Ending on June 30, 2006, by the Levy of Taxes on the Real Property in the City of New York in Accordance with the Provisions of the Constitution of the State of New York, the Real Property Tax Law and the Charter of the City of New York.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Governmental Operations

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enacting the New York city plumbing code based on the 2003 edition of the International Plumbing Code published by the International Code Council and enacting administrative provisions applicable to such New York city plumbing code and to such other codes as may hereafter be enacted by the city based on the 2003 editions of the International Building Code, the International Fuel Gas Code, the International Mechanical Code, and the International Residential Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Provide a time frame for the adoption and periodic updating of a modern construction code.

Items.Title: Resolution determining that Proposed Int. No. 478-A, a Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enacting the New York city plumbing code based on the 2003 edition of the International Plumbing Code published by the International Code Council and enacting administrative provisions applicable to such New York city plumbing code and to such other codes as may hereafter be enacted by the city based on the 2003 editions of the International Building Code, the International Fuel Gas Code, the International Mechanical Code and the International Residential Code, will not have a significant adverse impact on the environment.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Provide a time frame for the adoption and periodic updating of a modern construction code.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Naming of 67 thoroughfares and public places.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clarifying the rights of pet owners in multiple dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Clarifying the rights of pet owners in multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the federal government to increase the civil service examination preference point system, which currently awards 5-10 points to veterans of the armed forces applying for federal jobs, to 10-15 points.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Urging the federal government to increase the civil service examination preference point system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law so that non-police officers employed by state and municipal law enforcement agencies are mandated to wear safety belts while operating authorized emergency vehicles, and urging the New York City Police Commissioner to enforce the ban against unauthorized mobile telephone use by law enforcement personnel while operating authorized emergency vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Non-police officers employed by state and municipal law enforcement agencies are mandated to wear safety belts while operating authorized emergency vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York City Police Commissioner to improve the education of Traffic Enforcement Agents regarding the use of safety belts and hand-held mobile telephones, and to enforce any violations by Traffic Enforcement Agents of state statutes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Improve the education of Traffic Enforcement Agents.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the life and mourning the loss of Rosa Parks, an icon of the civil rights movement whose brave act of refusing to give up her seat on an Alabama bus in 1955 led to the end of legalized segregation in the United States; and further declaring that December 1st shall annually be observed as Rosa Parks Commemoration Day in New York City, and encouraging all businesses in the City, both public and private, to either close on December 1st or allow the many workers and students in the City who will want to attend Rosa Parks Commemoration events taking place during normal business hours, to take the day off, or leave work and school early with impunity .
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the life and mourning the loss of Rosa Parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to pedicabs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Pedicabs

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to protecting department of education employees from certain adverse personnel action.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Protecting department of education employees from certain adverse personnel action.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to authorizing the department of transportation to extend the date of the franchise for the operation and maintenance of bus stop shelters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the department of transportation to extend the date of the franchise for the operation and maintenance of bus stop shelters.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the Governor of Puerto Rico’s “crisis solutions” imposed in response to Puerto Rico’s debt and budget difficulties, and urging him to work with all unionized sectors of government and public corporations to develop better policies to address these problems.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the Governor of Puerto Rico’s “crisis solutions” imposed in response to Puerto Rico’s debt and budget difficulties.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in eleven business improvement districts and one special assessment district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in eleven business improvement districts and one special assessment district.

Items.Title: Resolution Amending and Restating the Resolution Computing and Certifying Base Percentage, Current Percentage and Current Base Proportion of Each Class of Real Property for Fiscal 2006 to the State Board of Real Property Services Pursuant to Section 1803-A, Real Property Tax Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending and Restating the Resolution Computing and Certifying Base Percentage, Current Percentage and Current Base Proportion of Each Class of Real Property for FY'06.

Items.Title: Resolution amending and Restating the Resolution Computing and Certifying Adjusted Base Proportion of Each Class of Real Property for Fiscal 2006 to the State Board of Real Property Services Pursuant to Section 1803-A, Real Property Tax Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending and Restating the Resolution Computing and Certifying Adjusted Base Proportion of Each Class of Real Property for FY'06.

Items.Title: Resolution amending and Restating the Resolution to Provide the Amounts Necessary for the Support of the Government of the City of New York and the Counties Therein and for the Payment of Indebtedness Thereof, for the Fiscal Year Beginning on July 1, 2005 and Ending on June 30, 2006, by the Levy of Taxes on the Real Property in the City of New York in Accordance with the Provisions of the Constitution of the State of New York, the Real Property Tax Law and the Charter of the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending and Restating the Resolution to Provide the Amounts Necessary for the Support of the Government of NYC and the Counties Therein.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the Metrotech Area, the 34th Street, the Grand Central, the Woodhaven, the Fifth Avenue, the Fashion Center, the Grand Street, the 125th Street, the Washington Heights, the Downtown-Lower Manhattan, and the Kings Highway Business Improvement Districts, and the Fulton Mall Special Assessment District, and the setting of the time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in eleven business improvement districts and one special assessment district.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to reject the nomination of Samuel A. Alito, Jr. as an Associate Justice to the Supreme Court of the United States.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Reject the nomination of Samuel A. Alito, Jr. as an Associate Justice to the Supreme Court of the US.
